name: TheAtlantic
text: "In exchange for access and information, Woodward offers Washington power holders the opportunity to disparage their rivals and aggrandize themselves," @davidfrum writes: https://t.co/ldSwQmx3ll

name: TheAtlantic
text: After my husband was killed on 9/11, I lived for our daughters, @esbakalian wrote in 2019: “The terrorists took my husband from me; there was no way I was going to let them ruin my daughters’ precious psyches too.” https://t.co/GrHaYXbnfQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Festival, taking place virtually September 21-24, announces new interviews: Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, Bill Gates, Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky, and Maryland Governor Larry Hogan. https://t.co/l8N0CC99wW

name: TheAtlantic
text: Books by Malcolm X, Austin Reed, Susan Burton, and others writing from prison raise vital questions about how we can build a more just society, in this week’s #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing. From @krisguillaume: https://t.co/tND5RSZNGA

name: TheAtlantic
text: Revisit a poem from yesteryear, read a short story, tour America from your couch, and other suggestions for the weekend. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/31SaJjPQBT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Elementary school science teacher Gary Koppelman thinks children are born with the traits of a good scientist. He built a lab with nearly 80 species of animals and more than 125 species of plants to let those instincts thrive, @kristinarizga reports: https://t.co/2zjPLmYqGN

name: TheAtlantic
text: Haruki Murakami’s early translated works, the subject of a fascinating new book, tell a complicated story about the business of bringing the best-selling novelist to a global audience, @RowanHLB writes: https://t.co/YJnSy8upz4

name: TheAtlantic
text: One progressive group's strategy to help Biden appeal to young voters: promote him as part of a group of "Democratic Avengers," @olgakhazan reports: https://t.co/N71hO2TBel

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: “It’s not because they are women that they were nonviolent and innovated tactics better,” @EricaChenoweth told me. “It’s that their particular position, the gendered roles that they had in society, gave them access to knowledge about social power.”

https://t.co/RaQscnmX4X

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Working out where Dod fits in the pantheon of sporting, and female, greatness is its own sort of feat,” @helenlewis writes. https://t.co/xdaeaZ3afd
